data.question: What is the DOI for the International Edition of the article discussing switchable cyanometalates?
What type of phase transition is described for the FeII/FeIII cyanide-bridged coordination polymer?
data.answer: A thermally induced charge-transfer phase transition

data.question: Does the FeFe cyanide-bridged system exhibit a charge-transfer-induced spin transition?
What is the electronic structure of the high-temperature phase of the coordination polymer?
What changes occur in the coordination polymer upon cooling to 123 K?
data.answer: The Fe¢N distances shorten, indicating a charge transfer between metal ions.

data.question: Is the transition entropy obtained from the charge-transfer phase transition greater than the spin-only value expected for the change in spin multiplicity?
What is the classification of the mixed-valence state of the coordination polymer according to the Robin and Day classification?
Does the coordination polymer exhibit thermochromic behavior in the NIR region upon cooling?
What is the role of bpe in the structure of the coordination polymer?
data.answer: Bpe ligands link the chains by coordinating along the apical positions of the FeII centers.

data.question: What is the significance of the transition entropy being much greater than the spin-only value?
data.answer: It indicates contributions from frequency shifts of molecular and lattice vibrations upon MMCT phase transition.

data.question: Is the FeCo system mentioned in the text also a homometallic cyanide-bridged system?
What is the molar ratio used in the synthesis of the target compound?
data.answer: 2:1:1 molar ratio of (Bu4N)[Fe(Tp)(CN)3], Fe(ClO4)2·6 H2O, and bpe in MeOH.

data.question: Does the coordination polymer's high-spin state change to a low-spin state during the phase transition?
What is the electronic structure of the coordination polymer in the low-temperature phase?
What does the presence of a reversible signal in the cooling–heating mode measurement indicate?
data.answer: The occurrence of a reversible charge-transfer process.

data.question: Is the charge transfer in compound 1 coupled to a spin transition?
What does the cm T value behavior of compound 1 indicate about its magnetic properties?
data.answer: It suggests the presence of ferromagnetic interactions between iron ions.

data.question: What is the role of the FeIII-LS-CN-FeII-HS-NC-FeIII-LS electronic structure?
data.answer: It is the electronic structure of the high-temperature phase of compound 1.

data.question: What does the appearance of new nCN stretches upon cooling indicate?
What is the significance of the study on the mixed-valence FeII/FeIII coordination polymer?
data.answer: It demonstrates a temperature-induced MMCT phase transition in a homometallic cyanide-bridged system.
